articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
The Leafly strain Explorer is expanding quickly, thanks to your suggestions and feedback! Check out this week's new indica, sativa, and hybrid additions: La Niña, Sugar Punch, Hustler Kush, Ortega, and Monster Cookies.
Visit their strain pages to write a review or to find availability near you!
   La Niña
Characteristics of La Niña:

75/25 sativa-dominant hybrid
Cross between Haze and White Widow
Breeder: Mr. Nice Seeds
Sweet, fruity aroma
Clear, functional effects
Indoor flowering time of 8 to 10 weeks

 
   Hustler Kush
Characteristics of Hustler Kush:

Indica-dominant hybrid
Breeder: Greenworks (Seattle, WA).
Sweet, earthy, piney aroma
Fast-acting and long-lasting effects

   Monster Cookies
Characteristics of Monster Cookies:

80/20 indica-dominant hybrid
Cross between GSC (f.k.a Girl Scout Cookies) and Granddaddy Purple
Earthy, grape, and berry aroma
Delivers a jarring dose of euphoria with full-body relaxation to follow

   Sugar Punch
Characteristics of Sugar Punch:

Sativa-dominant hybrid
Cross between Super Silver Haze and The One
Breeder: Sannie Seeds
Sweet, berry, and lemon aroma
Sedating, dreamy effects
Indoor flowering time of 9 to 10 weeks

   Ortega
Characteristics of Ortega:

Mostly indica 
Bred from Northern Lights genetics
Sweet, earthy aroma
Heavily tranquilizing
Indoor flowering time of 6 to 8 weeks
articles.title: New Strains Alert: La Niña, Sugar Punch, Hustler Kush, Ortega, and Monster Cookies

description: La Niña, a close relative of El Niño, is a sativa-dominant hybrid cross between Haze and White Widow. These large, airy buds offer a mild sweet, fruity aroma and clear, functional effects that make this strain a great daytime choice. Not recommended for beginning growers, this tall plant requires judicious attention until flowering between 8 and 10 weeks.
descriptionPlain: La Niña, a close relative of El Niño, is a sativa-dominant hybrid cross between Haze and White Widow. These large, airy buds offer a mild sweet, fruity aroma and clear, functional effects that make this strain a great daytime choice. Not recommended for beginning growers, this tall plant requires judicious attention until flowering between 8 and 10 weeks.

highlightedReviews.text: 🕸💨 La Niña is the love child of my dreams. Haze and White Widow are among my favorite strains of all time and to see what has become of the two is very exciting! Beautiful dark orange hairs on these buds that are completely coated in crystals. The taste is earthy with a nice sweetness. The high is VERY functional and clear headed. Nobody could tell I was stoned at work because it had me very focused and I didn't look high at all. Highly recommend this strain to anybody who loves it's lineage and for anyone looking for a good sativa! Green Therapeutics did a wonderful thing here! b-Myrcene: 3.59 mg/g, trans-Ocimene: 1.1 mg/g, b-Caryophylene: 0.9 mg/g.

name: La Niña
